docs.lead_paragraph: The $62 million settlement of a lawsuit by the New York Civil Liberties Union intends to reduce the number of inmates held in isolation and improve their living conditions.

docs.snippet: The $62 million settlement of a lawsuit by the New York Civil Liberties Union intends to reduce the number of inmates held in isolation and improve their living conditions....
docs.abstract: New York agrees to major overhaul of solitary confinement practices in state prisons, with aim of reducing both number of prisoners held in solitary and time spent in isolation; significant agreement, coming in response to lawsuit by New York Civil Liberties Union, will reduce number of solitary inmates by 25 percent and establish maximum time spent at three months.

headline.print_headline: Deal Alters Way New York State Isolates Inmates
